pr_title: [risk=no] A grab bag of small refactorings while doing other work

timeline.message: Constrain AuthInterceptor's special userService.createUser() to what it actually uses and rename to username
Split this off into its own function

timeline.bodyText: we must have missed this while standardizing on the new name
timeline.author: jmthibault79
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -17,19 +17,13 @@
 
   DbUser createServiceAccountUser(String email);
 
-  DbUser createUser(
-      String givenName,
-      String familyName,
-      String email,
-      String contactEmail,
-      String currentPosition,
-      String organization,
-      String areaOfResearch);
+  // minimal version used by AuthInterceptor
+  DbUser createUser(String givenName, String familyName, String userName);
 
   DbUser createUser(
       String givenName,
       String familyName,
-      String email,
+      String userName,

replies.bodyText: Yes. Sometimes the refactoring is smart enough to do what you want with these, but if one of the names is a substring of other identifiers, all heck breaks loose. Safer to risk leaving some local identifiers behind like this.
replies.author: jaycarlton

timeline.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: userInfo is a Google OAuth2 Userinfoplus object so "email" is correct from that perspective, though it's a "userName" to Workbench.
timeline.author: jmthibault79
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -155,18 +155,7 @@ public boolean preHandle(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse respons
       // TODO(danrodney): start populating contact email in Google account, use it here.
       user =
           userService.createUser(
-              userInfo.getGivenName(),
-              userInfo.getFamilyName(),
-              userInfo.getEmail(),

replies.bodyText: Can you put that comment in the code and replace userInfo with something like googleOAuth2id?
replies.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: Is there a more elegant way?  I want to be sure to exclude only this one, for future-proofing
timeline.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: Not worth spending much time on.
replies.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText:
This looks like a fun exercise, but it's way too abstract/reflexive for test code (or application code). Plus, I want to kill dbStorageEnums soon in favor of Lebowski Enums.
Can we shelve this for another day? I'm happy to pair on the enum stuff. It's a bit funny looking at first, but I think you'll like it.
replies.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: Some more English comments on what each chunk is doing would help. Most of us don't use these kinds of functions every day.
replies.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: I'll do that but in a follow up along with some other issues I've found
replies.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: Comments and fix are at #3159
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: Do we have a name for the old affiliations? Or did we give the new ones a different name?
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: New ones are Verified Institutional Affiliations
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: Can you comment on the semantics/lifecycle keeping these in sync, and why we don't need to here?
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: I know nothing about this.  I just moved it.
replies.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: We need to be careful moving the audit stuff like fireUpdateAction(). This looks right though. Can you please verify we still get the events written to the audit stream?
replies.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: What I moved was the updateInstitutionalAffiliations() block into its own method.  Everything else remained in the same location.
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: This is a good idea, but a larger refactoring than I am comfortable doing right now
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: CommonStorageEnums should throw IllegalArgumentException if it's not matched IMO. This assertion seems redundant; such checking is that method's job.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText:
I don't believe this is fixable without a wholesale rewrite of our enum system.
Which would be a good idea!  Just not in this tiny drive-by PR
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: You're just testing BiMap at this point I think.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: This actually does catch bugs!  Its StorageEnumsTest counterpart caught one of mine today - that's what prompted me to do this.  Remove an entry from one of the BiMaps to observe this.
replies.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText:
No, I get what it's doing, and it's awesome that it catches bugs.
Is there a reason you have to copy this instead of making a generic utility function to use in both enum classes?
replies.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: We have a one-way dependency from /api -> /common-api so any common code would have to live in /common-api.  I don't want to add any new /common-api dependencies.  We'll be removing /common-api entirely, soon after Dover.
replies.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: But why did your new enum maps need to go in common at all?
replies.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: They did not.  I saw that the /api test saved my butt and was curious if the /common-api would have as well.  It would not have, so I fixed that here.
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.message: ./project.rb connect-to-db now starts local DB if necessary
